page.title: 14THE POLICEMAN - WEST MEON
page.content: I have an interesting and varied life, forming part of a team of five Policeman, responsible for policing an area from Southwick to West Meon. On average there are twenty crimes reported in my area each year and crime plays only a small part in my working life. Daily duties include working both at Fareham and Droxford Police Stations, in my colleagues' villages and in my own village. In addition, I must be prepared to go anywhere in England and Wales for duties such as riot control. Incidents through the day are varied. My roles include those of adviser, social worker, enquiry agent, law enforcer and friend. It is fair to say that I must be prepared to deal with anything and my work is challenging and never dull. If I can help I will. ANDY MORLEY
